item.title: Bitcoin customers lose 36% of their money after hack
item.description:
Bitcoin customers lose 36% of their money after hack

Hong Kong-based Bitfinex said it's working to reopen the exchange by Monday. The platform was shut down on August 3 after 119,756 bitcoins, worth more than $65 million based on exchange rates at the time, were stolen from some users' accounts. Bitfinex said it decided "after much thought, analysis and consultations" to generalize the losses across all users.

item.title: Can IoT achieve autonomy without blockchain?
item.description:
Can IoT achieve autonomy without blockchain?

Of course if you define what you mean with autonomy. This means for things like tamper proof record keeping you need a Blockchain implementation. Imagine autonomous cameras with cryptographically proven timestamps. Without a Blockchain the owner of the camera could alter timestamps after the record (and of course all people who have relayed the video, too).

item.title: Bitfinex to Spread Losses From Cybertheft Among All Users
item.description:
Bitfinex to Spread Losses From Cybertheft Among All Users

Bitfinex, the digital-currency exchange that lost $65 million to hackers last week, plans to spread the losses among all its users, including those not directly impacted by the hack. The Hong Kong-based digital-currency exchange said in a statement Sunday that the losses from the theft would be shared, or "generalized across all accounts and assets" of its clients, with each taking a loss of around 36%.
